WorkItem.ClosedComment: Issues fixed or not, dev explained how it works
WorkItem.Description:
* Importing an old character file that was not run in 3.2 mode will not have 3.2 mode enabled on newer versions of Rawr.
* Tooltips for Owlkin Frenzy and Balance of Power have not been updated.
* Current calculations do not reflect the latest theorycraft concerning canceling Eclipse in order to chain them more effectively.

Comments.Message: Also, Haste is overvalued when over 401. I'm still getting the same problems [workitem:13797].

I am _not_ in the mood to argue with you or anyone about the value of haste.  It is still a decent stat over the 400 haste "soft cap", and anyone who disagrees can go suck an egg.  I don't make this stuff up; I just program into code what Arawethion writes in his spreadsheet.

The first bug (old Moonkin files not updating to 3.2 mode) should be fixed as of this morning.  I'm also preparing to trim out old code and get started on redoing the calculations for the latest version of the spreadsheet.

The major source of differences between WC and Rawr that I could find centered around the 4-piece T9 set bonus and whether it is additive or multiplicative.  I have changed it to be additive.  Also note, Rawr does not support the "feature" in WC/WoW where you can cancel your current Eclipse at the extreme end of your cast to chain Eclipse procs together.
